gurmukhi: rMg shwb ik PUl gulwb sy sIKy hYN joir krork Gwqy ] mwDurI mUriq suMdr sUrq hyriq hI hr lyq hIXw qy ]3]17]
transliteration: Ran Sahaab Ki Phool Gulaab Ke Seekhe Hain Jor(i) Darorak Ghaate|| Maadhuri Moondat(i) Soundar Soorat Herat(i) Hihar Let Heeyaa||3||17||
translation: His eyes can kill crores of people like the roses and seeing his comely figure, the mind gets fascinated on seeing him.3.17.

gurmukhi: pwn cbwie sINgwr bnwie sugMD lgwie sBw jb AwvY ] ik`nr j`C BujMg crwcr dyv Adyv doaU ibsmwvY ]
transliteration: Paan Chabade Seengadr Banaae Sougaddh Lagade Sabhaa Jab Aavai|| Kinnar Jachchh Bhujan Charaachar Dev Adev Dooo Bismaavai||
translation: When he went to the court on chewing the betel and fragrancing the body then all the Kinnars, Yakshas, Nagas, animate and inanimate beings, gods and demons were wonder-struck;

gurmukhi: moihq jy mih logn mwnin mohq qaun mhw suK pwvY ] vwrih hIr Amolk cIr qRIXw ibn DIr sBY bl jwvY ]4]18]
transliteration: Mohit Je Maih Logad Maanan(i) Mohat Taoun Mahaa Souch Paavai|| Vaarah(i) Heer Amolak Cheer Treeyaa Bin Dheer Sabhai Bal Jaavai||4||18||
translation: The human males and females were pleased on getting fascinated by him; they sacrificed their presious garments, diamonds and jewels on him impatiently.4.18.

gurmukhi: rUp Apwr pVy cwr mno Asurwr cqur ck jwnXo ] Awhv jukq ijqIk huqI jg srbn mY sB hI AnmwnXo ]
transliteration: Roop Apaar Pade Das Chaar Mano Asuraar Chatur Chak Jaanyo|| Aabav Joukat Jiteek Houtijag Sarban Mai Sabh Kianmaanyo||
translation: Indra also marveled at Parasnath, the most beautiful person and expert in all the fourteen science; he knew all the arts of warfare,

gurmukhi: dyis ibdysn jIq juDwNbr kiRq cMdov dso ids qwnXo ] dyvn ieMdR gopIn goibMd insw kr cMd smwn pCwnXo ]5]19]
transliteration: Des(i) Bidesan Jeet Judhaanbar Krit Channdov Daso Dis Taanyo|| Devan Indra Gopeen Gobind Nisaa Kar Channd Samaan Pachhaadyo||5||19||
translation: And after conquering all the countries far and near, he flag of victory waved in all the ten directions; the gods comprehended him as Indra, the gopis as Krishna and the night as the moon.5.19.

gurmukhi: cauiDq cwr idsw BeI c`kRq BUMm AkwS duhUM pihcwnw ] ju`D smwn lKXo jg joDn boDn boD mhw Anumwnw ]
transliteration: Chaudhit Chaar Disaa Bhai Chakkrat Bhoonm Akaadh Duhoon Paihhaanaa|| Juddh Samaan Lakhyo Jag Jodhan Bodhan Bodh Mahaa Anoumaanaa||
translation: Illumined like the full moon, Parasnath caused all the four directions wonder about him; he became famous everywhere on the earth and in the sky; the warriors recognized him as a warrior and the learned as learned;

gurmukhi: sUr smwn lKw idn kY iqh cMd srUp insw pihcwnw ] rwnin rwv svwinin swv Bvwinin Bwv Blo mn mwnw ]6]20]
transliteration: Soor Samaan Lakhaa Din Kai Tih Channd Saroop Nisaa Paihchaanaa|| Raanan(i) Raav Savaanin(i) Saav Bhavaanin(i) Bhaav Bhalo Man Maanaa||6||20||
translation: The day considered him as the sun and the night as the moon; the queens considered him as the king, other women as the husband and the goddess as love.6.20.

gurmukhi: ibqy brK dÍY ASt mwsM pRmwnM ] BXo su pRBM srb ibdXw inDwnM ] jpY ihMglw iTMglw pwx dyvI ] Anwsw CuDw AqRDwrI AByvI ]21]
transliteration: Bite Barakh Dvai Asht Maasan Pramaanan|| Bhayo Su Prabhan Sarab Bidyaa Nidhaanan|| Japai Hinglaa Thinglaa Paan Devee|| Anaasaa Chhudhaa Atradhaariabhevee||21||
translation: Two years and eight months passed and Parasnath, the store of all learnings was known as a glorious king; he repeated the names of he goddess of Hinglaaj and the weapon-wearing Durga.21.

gurmukhi: jpY qoqlw sIqlw K`g pwxI ] BRmw BYhrI BIm rUpw BvwxI ] clw cl isMGM JmwJMm A`qRM ] hhw hUih hwsM Jlw C`qRM ]22]
transliteration: Japai Totlaa Sitlaa Khagg Paanee|| Bhramaa Bhaiharibheem Roopaa Bhavaanee|| Chalaa Chal Singhan Jhamaa-jhanm Attran|| Hahaa Hooh(i) Haasan Jhalaa Jhal Chhattran||22||
translation: The worship of the goddesses like Shitala, Bhavani etc. was performed and the gleaming arms, weapons, splendour, canopy, pleasantry etc. increased his glory.22.

gurmukhi: Atw A`it hwsM Ctw Cut kysM ] AsM Ep pwnM nmo kRUr BysM ] isrM mwl sÍ`CM lsY dMq pMqM ] BjY SqR gÍVM pRPulMq sMqM ]23]
transliteration: Ataa Atttee Haasan Chhataa Chhout Kesan|| Asan Op Paanan Namo Kroor Bhesan|| Siran Maal Svachchhan Lasai Dant Pantan|| Bhajai Shatra Goodan Praphulant Santan||23||
translation: The beauty of his enjoyment and his hair appeared extremely comely and his sword glistened like lightning in his hands; he had worn a pure rosary on his head and the rows of his teeth looked magnificent; seeing him, the enemies fled away and the saints we

gurmukhi: AilMpwq ArDI mhw rUp rwjY ] mhw joq jÍwlM krwlM ibrwjY ]
transliteration: Alinpaat Ardhimahaa Roop Raajai|| Mahaa Jot Jvaalan Karaalan Biraajai||
translation: He appeared as a most beautiful king and there was a hideous halo of light around his face;

gurmukhi: BRmY duSt puStM hsY suD swDM ] Bjo pwn durgw ArUpI ArwDM ]24]
transliteration: Bhramai Dousht Poushtan Hasai Sudh Saadhan|| Bhajo Paan Durgaddaroopiaraadhan||24||
translation: On seeing him, the tyrants got illusioned and the saints smiled in their pleased mind; he remembered the formless and mysterious Durga,24.
